title: pysh
brief: Contribution to open-source cross-platform shell in python
description: PYSH is a cross-platform shell written in python language. The project is an open source project on github.
I contributed 3 commands for shell, namely, 'chmod', 'tree', and 'link'.

'chmod' command is used for changing access permission and the special mode flags of the file or directory. Optional '-c' flag is used to change permissions of directory contents along with the directory itself. Optional '-C' flag recursively changes permissions of contents of directory and its subdirectories as well.

'tree' command takes an optional parameter which is a directory path. It lists the contents of the directory and its sub-directories in a tree like format. The default directory is the current directory.
'link' command is used to form a hardlink or a softlink for a given file/directory. The '-h' flag indicates hardlink formation and '-s' flag indicates softlink formation.

title: python image editor
description: A simple image editor made using tkinter and pillow library of python.

The GUI is designed using the tkinter library of python. It contains of a main window of the application. The main window has a left side bar to show all the possible filters, center screen to display image, and right sidebar to show options under the selected feature.

The filters available are channel splitting (RGB), resizing, cropping, rotating, invert image, black-and-white filter, edge detection, edge enhancement, pencil sketch effect, slider-based thresholding, slider-based erosion, slider-based dilation, and adjusting blur, sharpness, brightness, saturation, and contrast

The program is converted to all including .exe using 'py-to-exe' python module to get an easy to use executable that does not require any additional software or modules to run it. The executable can run without installing python as well.

title: NaiveBaker
brief: A group project blogging platform to share recipes among budding fellow chefs
description: A software engineering group project in MERN stack where I played role of Group Leader.
The project is a simple responsive website where user can login, search recipes, see recipes in detail, and upload recipes after upgrading to premium
My contribution to the project as a the group leader was mainly in backend. I also worked on connecting frontend and backend, making website responsive, and fixing frontend-backend bugs.
I also worked backend-testing, keeping track of the work being done on the project by every team member, and resolving the merge-conflicts of teams' commits on github

However, there are still some features and functionalities still not-implemented like deleting user profile, searching recipes of a particular user, viewing user profile, following a user, rating recipes, upgrade to premium user, premium user regular user differentiation, and more.
